attributes.action: Cancel Requirements For HMO Properties To Have Wash Hand Basins In Sleeping Rooms
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
For landlords with HMO (Houses In Multiple Occupation) - one of the reqiurements is to have a wash basin in each sleeping room. The legislation does not really provide a sensible explanation for this neither 
can the local councils and we can only put it down to hygene standards. 
However if all bathrooms in any lettable property consists of a basin 
already then why do we need a wash basin in each room?  We have no hard 
facts about tenants being affected by poor health due to lack of wash basins 
in lettable rooms. Therefore what information is the requirement to have a 
wash basin in a lettable room actually based on?

It is beleived that this particular requirement of the HMO is not a 
reasonable request and would in most cases involve extensive plumbing work 
with very little gain for the tenants. On surveying the tenants in our 
properties most were not interested in having a wash basin in their own room.

This petition has been raised to eliminate the requirement for wash hand 
basins in sleeping rooms providing that all bathrooms and WCs have wash hand 
basins.  If you as a landlord or tenant are interested in appealing against 
this requirement then please sign our petition.
